dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 100 IH: Stopping Abusive Student Loan Collection Practices in Bankruptcy Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Conyers (for himself, Mr. Cohen, and Mr. Johnson of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 11 of the United States Code to stop abusive student loan collection practices in bankruptcy cases.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stopping Abusive Student Loan Collection Practices in Bankruptcy Act of 2015.

Section 523(d) of title 11 of the United States Code is amended by striking of this section and inserting or the debtor requests a determination of the dischargeability of a debt based on undue hardship under subsection (a)(8).

subsection.text: Except as provided in subsection (b), this Act and the amendment made by this Act shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
The amendment made by this Act shall apply only with respect to cases commenced under title 11 of the United States Code on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
